paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Oculoleptomeningeal amyloidosis (OLMA) with sensory and autonomic nerve dysfunction

individual_records.phenotype_details: Oculoleptomeningeal amyloidosis with sensory and autonomic nerve dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: OLMA was described in a Nigerian adult heterozygous for TTR L21P, a variant which was previously reported in several European-ancestry cases.

functional_data.summary: The TTR L21P variant is associated with OLMA, a rare manifestation of TTR amyloidosis.

variants.additional_notes: The variant has been previously reported in European-ancestry cases.
key_quotes: OLMA was described in a Nigerian adult heterozygous for TTR L21P, a variant which was previously reported in several European-ancestry cases.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Another common variant, at least among African-Americans (and found amongst West Africans), is the TTR V122I variant which was detected in the heterozygous state in 4% of African-Americans.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V122I variant is associated with hypertrophic restrictive cardiomyopathy.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with cardiomyopathy but not neuropathy.
key_quotes: Another common variant, at least among African-Americans (and found amongst West Africans), is the TTR V122I variant which was detected in the heterozygous state in 4% of African-Americans.

patients.phenotype: Cognitive changes, sensori-motor neuropathy with autonomic involvement and sensory ataxia

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cognitive changes, sensori-motor neuropathy with autonomic involvement and sensory ataxia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A man from Benin was reported with cognitive changes, a sensori-motor neuropathy with autonomic involvement and sensory ataxia, as well as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, and a TTR I107V variant.

functional_data.summary: The TTR I107V variant is associated with inherited amyloidosis.

variants.additional_notes: The variant has been found in several Europeans with inherited amyloidosis.
key_quotes: A man from Benin was reported with cognitive changes, a sensori-motor neuropathy with autonomic involvement and sensory ataxia, as well as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, and a TTR I107V variant.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants were extracted with detailed penetrance data.
